Interacting with individuals of different language abilities
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing verbal behavior
Assessing the effectiveness of language interventions
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and organizing language intervention programs

courseTitle: Applied Behavior Analysis: Personnel Supervision and Management
courseDescription: Application of behavior analytic principles and procedures to personnel supervision and management as well as implementation of evidence-based practices to provide effective supervision to enhance personnel performance across a variety of organizational settings.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing personnel performance
Problem-solving in a managerial context

courseTitle: Advanced Teacher Candidate Internship for Special Endorsement
courseDescription: This course provides supervised classroom experiences in settings serving students with disabilities. Enrolled students work collaboratively with classroom teachers to create and implement instructional plans targeting diverse learning needs. Total internship requirement is comprised of 7.5 weeks at the elementary level and 7.5 weeks at the weeks at the middle/secondary level.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of educational software and technology
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Verbal and non-verbal communication with students
Clear and effective communication of instructional plans
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adaptive teaching strategies for diverse learning needs
Problem-solving for classroom issues
Evaluation and adaptation of instructional plans
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Time management for different instructional periods

courseTitle: Directed Field Internship Special Education, K-12
courseDescription: The course provides supervised involvement in a practicum setting where the student and the instructor work together closely to develop curricula and gain expertise in teaching specific topics of importance to special educators. 50 hours per credit.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with special needs students
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Problem-solving in special education
Adaptation of teaching methods to individual learner needs
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leadership in a special education setting
Organizing and managing special education classroom
Time management for curriculum planning and delivery

courseTitle: Transition and Community-Based Instruction
courseDescription: This course provides an overview of the role of special educators in preparing students with severe disabilities for post-secondary vocational, residential, educational, community, and recreational settings. Emphasis is placed on developing appropriate curricula, involving students and their families in planning, implementing and evaluating transition programs, and helping students to access the services needed to be successful in adult life.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaboration with students and their families
Advocacy for students' access to services
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying necessary services for student success
Addressing challenges in vocational, residential, educational, and community settings
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Coordinating with community and recreational settings

courseTitle: Positive Behavior Supports
courseDescription: This course is designed specifically for teachers and other professionals working with individuals who have moderate to severe disabilities, including autism, or with young children who have disabilities. It is required for endorsement in Adapted Curriculum and Early Childhood Special Education. The primary focus is upon the concepts and skills needed (a) to design, implement, and evaluate individualized behavior support programs which derive from functional behavioral assessment, (b) to use effective teaching strategies to build relevant replacement skills, (c) to facilitate generalization and maintenance of skills, (d) to incorporate prevention strategies, (e) to improve the aspects of the student's environment that relate to the problem behavior, and (d) to incorporate, as appropriate, individually designed crisis intervention procedures
Technical and Digital Skills: Facilitating generalization and maintenance of skills
Improving environmental aspects related to problem behavior
Incorporating individually designed crisis intervention procedures
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Working with individuals with moderate to severe disabilities
Working with young children with disabilities
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Conducting functional behavioral assessment
Analyzing behavioral patterns
Identifying problem behavior and designing appropriate interventions

courseTitle: IEP, Assessment & Program Planning for Adapted Curriculum
courseDescription: This course is designed to develop knowledge and skills about best special education practice in assessment and evaluation for students with severe disabilities, and IEP and educational program planning for those preparing to teach K-12 students with disabilities in the adapted curriculum. Field experience required.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Communicating with students with severe disabilities
Tailoring communication based on individual student needs
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying appropriate teaching strategies for students with severe disabilities
Analyzing student performance and needs
Adapting curriculum to suit individual student requirements

courseTitle: Communication and Severe Disabilities
courseDescription: This course introduces professionals to augmentative and alternative communication (AAC) for individuals with severe speech and language impairments. It addresses the knowledge and skills that are needed to assess the potential AAC user, to make team decisions, to develop and implement instruction, and to evaluate the effects of instruction. The course is also aimed at motivating, building, and expanding communication, choice-making, and social interaction.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of augmentative and alternative communication (AAC)
Development and implementation of AAC instruction
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Evaluation of AAC instruction effects
Problem solving in AAC-related issues
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organization of AAC assessment and instruction
Leadership in AAC team decision making

courseTitle: Characteristics of Students with Severe Disabilities
courseDescription: Examines the academic, social, medical and behavioral characteristics of individuals with severe disabilities such as intellectual disability, autism, traumatic brain injury, and severe/multiple cognitive, physical and/or sensory disabilities. Focuses on etiology, contributing factors, impact on life and family, the challenges of identifying students with disabilities, and the need for intensive instruction, accommodations, and support.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Understanding impact on life and family
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Diagnosing severe disabilities
Creating suitable learning environments
Adjusting teaching strategies based on individual needs

courseTitle: Foundations of Language and Literacy for Diverse Learners
courseDescription: This course provides an understanding of the development of emergent and early literacy in developmentally-typical learners and learners with complex language and learning needs, as well as the inter-relationship of language and literacy development. Emphasis will be placed on identifying effective research-based strategies for promoting and enhancing emergent literacy and early reading and writing skills for children and youth with language and intellectual disabilities and English language learners with disabilities. Field experience is required: course participants must identify an appropriate target student and engage in observation and assessment activities with that student and his/her family during the first half of the course. Final product includes the development of a literacy development plan for the student.
Technical and Digital Skills: Development and Implementation of a Literacy Development Plan
Observation and Assessment of Learners' Literacy Skills
Understanding of Complex Language and Learning Needs
Promotion and Enhancement of Emergent Literacy and Early Reading and Writing Skills
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis of Language and Literacy Development
Identification of Effective Research-Based Strategies
Problem Solving for Learners with Language and Intellectual Disabilities

courseTitle: Curriculum and Methods-Severe Disabilities
courseDescription: This course focuses on current best practices in curriculum and methods for students with severe disabilities, including specific strategies for teaching students with severe disabilities, general strategies for working with heterogeneous groups of students in inclusive settings, and methods for adapting the general education curriculum to include students with severe disabilities.
Technical and Digital Skills: Implementing specific strategies for teaching students with severe disabilities
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Working with heterogeneous groups of students in inclusive settings
Communicating effectively with students with severe disabilities
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Developing unique solutions for individual student needs
Analysing the effectiveness of teaching strategies
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizing and managing individualized learning plans

courseTitle: Consultation and Collaboration
courseDescription: This course provides professionals in special education, regular education, and related fields with knowledge and communications skills necessary for collaborative consultation and technical assistance to other educators and service providers.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing educational needs
Developing consultation strategies
Problem-solving in an educational context

courseTitle: Individualized Supports and Specialized Care of Students with Significant Disabilities
courseDescription: Provides an understanding of the unique physical, sensory, communication, and health and medical needs of students with significant disabilities, how these needs impact the educational program, how special education and related services are delivered, and how to design academic, functional and behavioral instruction and adaptations to meet those needs.
Technical and Digital Skills: Designing academic, functional, and behavioral instruction
Adapting educational programs to meet specific needs
Understanding and incorporating special education and related services
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Understanding unique physical, sensory, and communication needs
Communicating effectively with students with significant disabilities
Adapting communication to meet individual needs
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing the impact of disabilities on educational programs
Identifying and addressing health and medical needs
Creating individualized supports based on unique student needs
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Designing and implementing specialized care plans
Coordinating with other professionals and stakeholders

courseTitle: Topics in Special Education
courseDescription: This course offers selected topics designed to permit small groups of qualified students to work on subjects of mutual interest in the special education field.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with special needs students
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Individualized education program planning
Behavioural analysis and intervention
Adaptive teaching strategies
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Classroom management for special needs students

courseTitle: Independent Study
courseDescription: Independent study of special topics in special education for graduate students.
Technical and Digital Skills: Adaptation of educational materials to individual needs
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Communication strategies for special needs students
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Assessment of individual educational needs
Development of personalized education plans

courseTitle: Research Project
courseDescription: This capstone seminar is one of the culminating assessments for the master's degree in education with a major in advanced special education. Students will design, develop, and deliver an evidence-based professional development program that is aligned with their concentrations. As a culminating activity, this project will reflect the synthesis of coursework, research, and practical experience as these program aspects relate to the needs of school divisions and the education of students from diverse backgrounds.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Synthesis of coursework, research, and practical experience
Adapting programs to the needs of school divisions and diverse students
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leadership in delivering professional development programs

courseTitle: Historical and Contemporary Research in Special Education
courseDescription: This course covers contemporary and historical topics related to problem issues in special education.  This is a course of study that will enable participants to examine various topics in special education and research a position on an issue.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of contemporary and historical special education issues
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Presenting and defending a position on an issue
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical assessment of special education issues
Problem identification in special education
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizing and planning a research project
Leading discussions on special education issues

courseTitle: Cognitive Processes and Learning Strategies for Students with Special Needs
courseDescription: The intent of this course is to provide an overview of research and critical issues relative to the cognitive and affective development of individuals with disabilities.  Research-based interventions that address deficits of cognitive processes will be discussed and specific learning strategies will be presented.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding cognitive processes in individuals with disabilities
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of cognitive development issues
Designing interventions for cognitive deficits
Analyzing affective development in individuals with disabilities

courseTitle: Advanced Instructional Procedures in Special Education
courseDescription: This course provides students with advanced skills in educational planning, development, and implementation for students with learning problems.  Techniques focus on inclusive and self-contained classroom arrangements.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Adaptive communication with students with learning problems
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying and addressing learning problems
Adapting teaching methods to individual students' needs
Designing inclusive and self-contained classroom arrangements

courseTitle: Curriculum and Instruction: Research Into Practice
courseDescription: This course provides an overview of research methods employed in the field of special education.  Current trends related to curriculum and instruction in general and special education will be investigated.  Strategies and procedures for identifying learner characteristics and application of that knowledge will be included. Implementation of quality curricular modifications and/or instructional accommodations for students with diverse needs in a variety of educational settings and evaluation of instruction will be addressed.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Application of knowledge in diverse educational settings
Communication with students with diverse needs
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Evaluation of instruction
Analysis of current trends in special education
Strategizing procedures for identifying learner characteristics
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leadership in implementing quality curricular modifications
Management of educational settings with diverse needs

courseTitle: Concepts and Principles in Behavior Analysis
courseDescription: This course focuses on the basic concepts and principles of behavior analysis and the identification of factors that increase or decrease the probability of behavior under specific circumstances.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing behavior under specific circumstances
Problem-solving through behavior analysis

courseTitle: Research Methods in Behavior Analysis
courseDescription: Applications of single-case experimental research designs to the analysis of behavior, with emphasis on measurement, visual display of data, and interpretation, intervention and plan evaluation, and research ethics.
Technical and Digital Skills: Application of single-case experimental research designs
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis of behavior
Data interpretation and analysis
Problem-solving through intervention and plan evaluation

courseTitle: Ethics in Behavior Analysis
courseDescription: This course provides a basis in Virginia Behavior Analyst Licensure law, the Behavior Analyst Certification Board’s Ethical and Professional Issues  including ethics codes and requirements, the BACB’s code-enforcement mechanisms, and professionalism relevant to the delivery of behavior-analytic services.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of Virginia Behavior Analyst Licensure law
Knowledge of Behavior Analyst Certification Board’s Ethical and Professional Issues
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing ethical issues in behavior analysis
Applying BACB’s code-enforcement mechanisms in practical situations
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading ethical compliance in behavior analysis

courseTitle: Assessments and Interventions I: Positive Behavior Support
courseDescription: This course focuses on the identification and assessment of problem behavior and socially appropriate behaviors, the development, implementation, and evaluation of function-based intervention plans, and the design of environments to prevent and address problem behavior.
Technical and Digital Skills: Environment design to prevent and address problem behavior
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Behavioral analysis
Problem-solving for behavioral issues
Strategic planning for preventing problem behavior

courseTitle: Theory and Philosophy in Behavior Analysis
courseDescription: This course focuses on the underlying theoretical and philosophical foundations of behavior analysis. A special emphasis will be placed on radical, contextual, and methodological behaviorism and their historical roots. Applications to behavior-analytic problem  solving and case conceptualization in applied settings will be discussed.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of theoretical foundations of behavior analysis
Knowledge of radical, contextual, and methodological behaviorism
Application of behavior-analytic problem solving in applied settings
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Discussion and debate of theoretical perspectives
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Behavior-analytic problem solving
Critical analysis of behavior theories
Application of behavior theories to real-world situations
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Application of behavior theory in leadership and organizational contexts

courseTitle: Assessments and Interventions II: Verbal Behavior
courseDescription: This course focuses on B. F. Skinner’s analysis of verbal behavior, assessment of verbal behavior, and the development, implementation, and evaluation of interventions to enhance the communicative repertoire of individuals with complex communication needs.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of Skinner's analysis of verbal behavior
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Adapting communication strategies for individuals with complex needs
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing verbal behavior patterns
Problem-solving for complex communication needs
Assessing effectiveness of communication interventions

courseTitle: Organizational Behavior Management
courseDescription: Application of behavior-analytic principles and procedures to personnel supervision and management as well as implementation of evidence-based practices to provide effective supervision and to enhance personnel performance across a variety of organizational settings.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Evaluating practices for effectiveness
Analyzing personnel performance

courseTitle: Supervised Fieldwork in Applied Behavior Analysis
courseDescription: Supervised fieldwork experiences that apply University-approved coursework to instruction of children, youth, and their families in the natural environment. As stated in the BCBA Experience Standards, the purpose of supervised fieldwork experiences is to improve and maintain the behavior analytic, professional, and ethical repertoires of the supervisee and facilitate the delivery of high quality services to clients. Students can enroll in supervised fieldwork hours concurrently with the ODU ABA certificate approved sequence coursework.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Behavioral analysis
Problem-solving in natural environments
Ethical decision-making

courseTitle: Independent Study
courseDescription: Independent study of special topics in special education for advanced graduate, or doctoral students.
Technical and Digital Skills: Advanced knowledge in special education topics
Ability to use research tools and platforms for independent study
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to communicate complex special education concepts
Proficiency in academic writing and presenting research findings
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of special education literature
Ability to formulate research questions and hypotheses
Data analysis in the context of special education
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Project planning and execution in an academic context

courseTitle: Historical and Contemporary Research in Special Education
courseDescription: This course covers contemporary and historical topics related to problem issues in special education.  This is a course of study that will enable participants to examine various topics in special education and research a position on an issue.
Technical and Digital Skills: Data analysis in special education contexts
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Constructive argumentation on special education issues
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical analysis of special education issues
Problem identification in special education

courseTitle: Cognitive Processes and Learning Strategies for Students with Special Needs
courseDescription: The intent of this course is to provide an overview of research and critical issues relative to the cognitive and affective development of individuals with disabilities.  Research-based interventions that address deficits of cognitive processes will be discussed and specific learning strategies will be presented.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with individuals with disabilities
Interpersonal understanding of cognitive and affective development
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis of cognitive and affective development
Identifying and addressing cognitive process deficits
Adapting learning strategies to individual needs

courseTitle: Scholarly Writing for Doctoral Students
courseDescription: This course targets the knowledge and skills required to successfully engage in scholarly writing. Specific course topics include, the use of the American Psychological Association Publication Manual (APA) to guide the basic elements of style (i.e., creating and writing from an outline, manuscript organization, sentence and paragraph construction, marks of punctuation, use of quotations, use of references, bias free language, editing and revising, proofreading, revising drafts, and resubmission), and the development of professional writing skills, such as drafting, writing, editing, revising, responding to reviews, interpreting and synthesizing professional journal articles.
Technical and Digital Skills: Use of American Psychological Association Publication Manual (APA)
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Sentence and paragraph construction
Revision of drafts
Resubmission
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Creating and writing from an outline

courseTitle: Advanced Instructional Procedures in Special Education
courseDescription: This course provides students with advanced skills in educational planning, development, and implementation for students with learning problems.  Techniques focus on inclusive and self-contained classroom arrangements.
Technical and Digital Skills: Adapting classroom arrangements for inclusive education
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Communicating effectively with students with learning problems
Collaborating with fellow educators for student development
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying learning problems
Creating learning strategies for students with learning problems
Analyzing the effectiveness of educational plans
Problem-solving for inclusive and self-contained classroom arrangements

courseTitle: Alternative Strategies for Elementary Students: Prevention and Intervention
courseDescription: The intent of this course is to provide pre-service and in-service teachers with the knowledge and skill to collaborate with other professionals to identify and remediate students who are at-risk for school problems due to academic challenges and/or behavior, and to effectively support students with identified mild disabilities in general education classrooms.  The course focuses on developing proactive pre-referral interventions and working with general educators to develop and implement effective interventions, accommodations, modifications and supports for students with mild difficulties in general education classes.
Technical and Digital Skills: Identifying and remediating students who are at-risk due to academic challenges
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Supporting students with identified mild disabilities
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Addressing academic challenges and behavioral issues
Proactive pre-referral interventions

courseTitle: Curriculum and Instruction: Research Into Practice
courseDescription: This course provides an overview of research methods employed in the field of special education.  Current trends related to curriculum and instruction in general and special education will be investigated.  Strategies and procedures for identifying learner characteristics and application of that knowledge will be included. Implementation of quality curricular modifications and/or instructional accommodations for students with diverse needs in a variety of educational settings and evaluation of instruction will be addressed.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Investigating current trends in curriculum and instruction
Analyzing diverse needs in different educational settings
Evaluating instruction

courseTitle: Critical Issues I: Readings in Special Education and Professional Writing
courseDescription: The intent of this course is to provide doctoral candidates the opportunity to further advance their research and professional writing skills and critically evaluate the quality and empirical evidence of critical and timely topics in special education by conducting systematic literature reviews and meta-analysis of published studies. The course stresses APA writing guidelines and style, conducting literature searches, and writing a product that is suitable for publication.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical thinking
Problem-solving
Analytical skills
Interpretation of empirical evidence

courseTitle: Critical Issues II: Research and Professional Writing
courseDescription: This course provides doctoral candidates an opportunity to (a) become familiar with reading, analyzing, synthesizing, and writing research related to their personal professional interests to contribute to the literature, (b) acquire skills related to developing original research, and (c) develop proposals, presentations, and other scholarly skills necessary for promotion and tenure in higher education and professional institutions. Emphasis is placed on the critical analysis of research and synthesis of the literature that identifies research gaps, and the design of a prospective study or dissertation proposal to examine the topic of interest.
Technical and Digital Skills: Writing research related to personal professional interests
Designing a prospective study or dissertation proposal
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying research gaps
Critical analysis of research
Synthesizing literature
Developing proposals to examine topics of interest

courseTitle: Single Subject Research
courseDescription: Single Subject Research.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Formulating research questions
Analyzing research results
Critical evaluation of research data

courseTitle: Internship: Research in Special Education
courseDescription: This course provides doctoral students the opportunity to design and conduct an independent pilot research study in their area of interest under the guidance of a faculty member while refining their research skills. The successful completion of a 3-credit internship is required to fulfill the research competency of the program.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying research areas of interest
Evaluating research results
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Guiding research process under faculty supervision

courseTitle: Professional Seminar: Teaching, Research, and Service
courseDescription: This course prepares doctoral candidates to meet professional standards in teaching, research and service in special education in higher education institutions.  Teaching includes an understanding of adult learning and the design, delivery, evaluation of content, and use of technology in college teaching.  Research includes recognizing and critically discussing scholarly work, systematically planning and preparing for research, and developing research proposals.  Service includes identifying professional organizations and agencies and creating integrated professional development programs.  The course is designed to build skills necessary for advancement in higher education and professional institutions.
Technical and Digital Skills: Use of technology in college teaching
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of scholarly work
Systematic planning for research
Designing effective teaching content
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading in higher education and professional institutions

courseTitle: Independent Study: Teaching in Special Education
courseDescription: This course provides doctoral students the opportunity to teach an undergraduate or graduate-level course in special education using various delivery formats such as in-person, synchronous online, or asynchronous online while gaining experiences in teaching at the university level. The successful completion of this course is required to fulfill the teaching competency of the program.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Curriculum development and adjustment
Handling and resolving classroom issues
Assessing student learning needs and tailoring teaching methods

courseTitle: Dissertation
courseDescription: Dissertation.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical analysis
Hypothesis testing
Problem framing

courseTitle: Master's Graduate Credit
courseDescription: This course is a pass/fail course for master's students in their final semester. It may be taken to fulfill the registration requirement necessary for graduation. All master's students are required to be registered for at least one graduate credit hour in the semester of their graduation.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: N/A

courseTitle: Doctoral Graduate Credit
courseDescription: This course is a pass/fail course doctoral students may take to maintain active status after successfully passing the candidacy examination.  All doctoral students are required to be registered for at least one graduate credit hour every semester until their graduation.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Maintaining active student status
Planning for graduation requirements
